title: Ben Bridge logo Script
content:
Hi again, I need to know what font this is.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706164337im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/logo_top_4218.gif)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706164337im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/logo_bot_5890.gif)

 [‹ (x) Numbers with a No - Crash Numbering {Marc O}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706164337/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35703 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Bellingham Nanny loopy script - Giddyup {Ralf Herrmann} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706164337/http:/www.typophile.com/node/35692 "Go to next forum topic")
author: retoid

comments.content: Thats definitely close but not exact. It might do.

It is hard to tell for sure with that separated sample, but I think it is CAC Lasko Condensed. It might have other names. I’ll add to this if I fond more:

Closer reading says it is an American Greetings font. Which would seem to be a sort of commercial font, so I am removing the link. The name will get you back there if necessary.
I dont understand what you mean by: “The name will get you back there if necessary.”

I think Mike is at the Typecon, but feel free to browse his script guide here:

[http://bowfinprintworks.com/Script01Pg1.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706164337/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Script01Pg1.html "http://bowfinprintworks.com/Script01Pg1.html")

You will need better eyes than I have.  
: )

<cite>I dont understand what you mean by: “The name will get you back there if necessary.”</cite>

CAC Lasko condensed...as in google? It isn’t proper to post unauthorized links to commercial fonts here. Now that I pasted your two samples together, I see it isn’t all that close as I thought.
I see what you mean. However, it was none of those scripts.
